/wiki/Esporte_Clube_Aracruz: Esporte Clube Aracruz, commonly known as Aracruz, is a Brazilian football club based in Aracruz, Espírito Santo state. The club was formerly known as Esporte Clube Sauassu. They won the Campeonato Capixaba once.
/wiki/Aracruz,_Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo: Aracruz is a municipality at the central coast of Espírito Santo, Brazil.
/wiki/Colatina_Sociedade_Esportiva: Colatina Sociedade Esportiva, commonly known as Colatina, is a Brazilian football club based in Colatina, Espírito Santo state.
/wiki/Colatina: Colatina is the second largest city in the north of Espírito Santo, Brazil, 127 km north of the capital Vitória and on the trainline from Vitória to Minas Gerais. It lies on the banks of the Doce river, through which as much as 700 cubic meters of water per second may flow. Its population was 121,580 (2018 est.) and its area is 1,398 km².
/wiki/Conilon_Futebol_Clube_de_Jaguar%C3: Conilon Futebol Clube de Jaguaré, commonly known as Conilon, is a Brazilian football club based in Jaguaré, Espírito Santo state. The club was formerly known as Botafogo Futebol Clube de Jaguaré.
/wiki/Jaguar%C3%A9: Jaguaré is a municipality located in the Brazilian state of Espírito Santo. Its population was 21,098 (2005) and its area is 656 km².
/wiki/Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo_Futebol_Clube: Espírito Santo Futebol Clube, commonly known as Espírito Santo, is a Brazilian football club based in Espírito Santo state.
/wiki/Anchieta,_Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo: Anchieta is a  municipality in the Brazilian state of Espírito Santo. Its population was 27,624 in 2015 and its area is 412 km². Its average elevation is 2m above sea level.
/wiki/Linhares_Futebol_Clube: Linhares Futebol Clube, usually known simply as Linhares, is a Brazilian football club from Linhares, Espírito Santo.
/wiki/Linhares: Linhares is the name of a municipality in the state of Espírito Santo, Brazil, 135 kilometres (84 mi) north of the state capital, Vitória. It is the largest municipality by area in the state, at 9,501.6 km², and has a population of 157.814 people (2013).
/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_Joaquim_Calmon: Estádio Joaquim Calmon is a sports stadium in Linhares, Espírito Santo, Brazil.
/wiki/Real_Noroeste_Capixaba_Futebol_Clu: Real Noroeste Capixaba Futebol Clube, commonly known as Real Noroeste, is a Brazilian football club based in Águia Branca, Espírito Santo state. They competed in the Copa do Brasil once.
/wiki/%C3%81guia_Branca: Águia Branca ("white eagle" in English) is a municipality located in the west-central portion of the state of Espírito Santo, in southeastern Brazil. The municipality has a population of 10,065 (2015) and its area is 454 km².
/wiki/Rio_Branco_Atl%C3%A9tico_Clube: Rio Branco Atlético Clube, or Rio Branco, as they are usually called, is a Brazilian football team from Vitória in Espírito Santo, founded on June 21, 1913.
/wiki/Vit%C3%B3ria,_Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo: Vitória (Portuguese pronunciation: [viˈtɔɾjɐ], Victory), spelled Victória until the 1940s, is the capital of the state of Espírito Santo, Brazil. It is located on a small island within a bay where a number of rivers meet the sea. It was founded in 1551. The city proper 93 square kilometres (36 square miles) has a population of 358,875 (2015) whilst the Greater Vitória metropolitan area has a population of more than 1,857,616 (2013), the 14th largest in Brazil.
/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_Engenheiro_Alencar_Ar: Estádio Engenheiro Alencar Araripe or Arena Unimed Sicoob (for sponsorship reasons) is a stadium in Cariacica, Espírito Santo, Brazil. It has a capacity of 7,700 spectators. It is the home of Desportiva Ferroviária.
/wiki/Sociedade_Desportiva_Serra_Futebol: Sociedade Desportiva Serra Futebol Clube, usually known simply as Serra is a Brazilian football club from Serra, Espírito Santo state. The club won the Campeonato Capixaba six times.
/wiki/Serra,_Esp%C3%ADrito_Santo: Serra is a municipality in the state of Espírito Santo, Brazil. Bordering the north of the state's capital, Vitória, the municipality is part of the Greater Vitória metropolitan area. Its population was 507,598 (2018) and its area is 553 km2.
/wiki/Centro_Educativo_Recreativo_Associ: Centro Educativo Recreativo Associação Atlética São Mateus, commonly known as São Mateus, is a Brazilian football club based in São Mateus, Espírito Santo state. They competed in the Copa do Brasil and in the Série C once.
/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Mateus,_Esp%C3%ADrito_San: São Mateus is a municipality located in the Brazilian state of Espírito Santo. Its population was 128,542 (estimation 2018) and its area is 2,346 km².  São Mateus is located at 36 meters above sea level.
/wiki/Vit%C3%B3ria_Futebol_Clube_(ES): Vitória Futebol Clube, usually known simply as Vitória (or as Vitória-ES) is a traditional Brazilian football club from Vitória, Espírito Santo state.
